intro: Psychotria ilendensis, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a tropical shrub native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Psychotria ilendensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
